offer_description: Do you have experience in IT Service Management, working with cloud providers, software development, and technology infrastructure? Are you passionate about the chance to bring your skills to a world-class content-driven technology organization? If yes, come join our team and develop your career with our growing global center in Gdansk, Poland.

We have had a presence in Gdansk since 2019, with our campus providing access to the accessibility, culture, and diversity of the Tricity (Gdańsk, Gdynia, and Sopot) metropolitan area, plus the beauty of being on the Baltic Sea and close to lush forests.

The CIO (Chief Information Office) organization in Thomson Reuters provides shared capabilities spanning Service Management, Digital Commerce, Platforms Engineering, and Architecture.  The CIO organization is driving a change to bring closer alignment of the technology work we do, to the product and business outcomes.  The services from CIO are delivered through a shared capability model and implemented by a strong, talented, diverse set of global teammates. Through the use of modern technology, platforms and services, and closer alignment to business stakeholders, we maintain a focus on customers, while making it easier for our internal consumers to use our services. Gdansk is the home of Service Management and is at the epicenter of how we manage our customers’ experience.

The Lead Site Reliability Engineer will analyze chronic and major issues, evaluate products and their services, make recommendations to improve service outcomes, design solutions in partnership with product, engineering, and architecture teams, build, test, operationalize tools and applications to improve customer experience and reduce costs.  Additionally, the Lead Site Reliability Engineer will provide oversight and coaching to engineers and be an escalation for our global command center engineers.
We have multiple opportunities at different levels of seniority
Join our team today and you can bring your innovation, knowledge, and curiosity to create technology that powers the world’s most informed professionals.
responsibilities: Service design, service operations, release, development and support
Leading the work to drive efficiencies and reduce service operations risks.
Leading the research of new capabilities, testing new solutions, recommending and implementing new technologies to improve customer experience and reduce costs.
Collaborating and partnering with cross functional teams to solve intractable problems and devising solutions to improve the products and services we offer our customers.

offer_description: At Bayer we’re visionaries, driven to solve the world’s toughest challenges and striving for a world where ,Health for all, Hunger for none’ is no longer a dream, but a real possibility. We’re doing it with energy, curiosity and sheer dedication, always learning from unique perspectives of those around us, expanding our thinking, growing our capabilities and redefining ‘impossible’. There are so many reasons to join us. If you’re hungry to build a varied and meaningful career in a community of brilliant and diverse minds to make a real difference, there’s only one choice.

In Bayer’s global Research and Development IT department we thrive to continuously improve our existing product portfolio and create new products that support our scientists in Pharma on their search for new (digital) therapies. We are seeking excellent Data Engineers (m/f/d) driven by our vision “Health for all, hunger for none”. If you are passionate about creating cutting edge software together with scientists to help cure life-threatening diseases, we would love to hear from you.

Bayer welcomes applications from all individuals, regardless of race, national origin, gender, age, physical characteristics, social origin, disability, union membership, religion, family status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression or any unlawful criterion under applicable law. We are committed to treating all applicants fairly and avoiding discrimination.

Bayer is committed to providing access and reasonable accommodations in its application process for individuals with disabilities and encourages applicants with disabilities to request any needed accommodation(s) using the contact information below.

Bayer offers the possibility of working in a hybrid model. We know how important work-life balance is, so our employees can work from home, from the office or combine both work environments. The possibilities of using the hybrid model are each time discussed with the manager.
responsibilities: You create and maintain an optimal data structure and pipeline architecture
You have an idea about infrastructure required to optimally extract, transform, and load data from a diverse data sources using various modern and big data technologies
You help our team to turn scientific datasets into a data product, so that it can be further analyzed, visualized, and processed.
You identify and address risks and gaps in technical approaches and develop solutions to meet team and product goals and make your product better
You keep yourself informed about new tools, technologies and architecture patterns and look for opportunities to apply your findings to your tech stack
Apply continuous delivery practices to deliver high quality data pipelines

offer_description: At

, we believe in developing potential so we’re not looking for the perfect candidate with gold medals and superpowers. Even if you don’t have everything listed below, if you think you could be great in this role please do apply.  We want to hear from you. Truly!
We started

because we believe that dealing with data at scale requires more intelligent systems. The proliferation of data formats, complexity and volumes are causing big issues in enterprises, who spend billions dealing with the resulting problems. It doesn’t need to be this way. Today, Duco provides Software as a Service (SaaS) solutions in the cloud to Financial Services, Insurance, and FinTech companies dealing with mission-critical data management issues and provides firms on-demand data integrity and insight, helping to drive operational efficiency, business agility and strategic decision-making.

mission is to “make managing data easy” by replacing spreadsheets and technology-heavy solutions in areas like data prep, reconciliation, data quality and data management with a user-friendly, machine learning-powered platform.
Headquartered in London, with offices in the UK, US, Singapore, and Poland,
software is used by 14 of the top 30 global banks, asset managers with over $10 trillion in assets, leading payments innovators, exchanges and custodians, and insurers.
We’re going through a high growth phase, so we’re seeking several talented developers to join our Development team and be part of something truly transformational in the data space.
There’s one big difference here:

We put people first. Always! We genuinely care about transparency and we make sure to give everyone a voice. Regardless of roles or seniority levels, we value all opinions and input. We communicate honestly, whether the news is good or bad, and share knowledge and successes openly. Our philosophy is always to support, not micromanage.
Don’t take our word for it though, this is reflected in our Glassdoor reviews!

Developers at Duco work as part of an agile, cross-functional, empowered engineering team. Each autonomous team owns the destiny of their part of the product and makes decisions jointly, alongside representatives from Product, Sales and other customer advocates. They don't just "code up" stuff that someone else specifies.  Because where’s the joy in that?

You could be developing our award-winning reconciliation platform to meet future scaling requirements. Or building out our data prep (ingestion and transformation) product. Or maybe both, by helping refactor common components to a fully service-oriented architecture.

In terms of technologies, the ‘heavy lifting’ is mostly done in Java; web frameworks in use include Ruby on Rails and Spring Boot; and we utilise both MySQL and Clickhouse databases. It all runs in a cloud infrastructure which leverages Kubernetes, Docker and Helm.  We also care very much about the developer experience, so we invest in the right tooling. Recently, that’s included projects involving Gitlab, Bazel and automation testing frameworks.
And across the stack, you should expect continuous diversification and development. We improve through innovation, so we welcome the impetus that new eyes and fresh perspectives can bring.
responsibilities: Designing and building new features, new services and new technologies
Ensuring the code you and your team deliver is supportable and highest quality
Working with Product Owners to understand customers and scope out work
Performing code reviews for others, and having your code reviewed by your peers
Teaching and mentoring less experienced colleagues

company_details: Founded in: We make managing your mission-critical data easy!
company_description: We started Duco because we believe that dealing with data at scale requires more intelligent systems. The proliferation of data formats, complexity and volumes are causing big issues in enterprises, who spend billions dealing with the resulting problems. It doesn’t need to be this way.

Duco provides innovative technology that empowers end users to consolidate, standardise and reconcile any type of data in Duco’s cloud. We give firms on-demand data integrity and insight, helping to drive operational efficiency, business agility and strategic decision-making.
Our SaaS solution is used by some of the largest companies in the world, including international banks, investment managers, exchanges, insurance firms and challenger fintech companies.
As a growth company, our working style is agile and entrepreneurial. People have real opportunities to shape and influence their roles, teams, the product and Duco itself.

offer_description: Do you have experience in IT Service Management, working with cloud providers, software development, and technology infrastructure? Are you passionate about the chance to bring your skills to a world-class content-driven technology organization? If yes, come join our team and develop your career with our growing global center in Gdansk, Poland.

We have had a presence in Gdansk since 2019, with our campus providing access to the accessibility, culture, and diversity of the Tricity (Gdańsk, Gdynia, and Sopot) metropolitan area, plus the beauty of being on the Baltic Sea and close to lush forests.

The CIO (Chief Information Office) organization in Thomson Reuters provides shared capabilities spanning Service Management, Digital Commerce, Platforms Engineering, and Architecture.  The CIO organization is driving a change to bring closer alignment of the technology work we do, to the product and business outcomes.  The services from CIO are delivered through a shared capability model and implemented by a strong, talented, diverse set of global teammates. Through the use of modern technology, platforms and services, and closer alignment to business stakeholders, we maintain a focus on customers, while making it easier for our internal consumers to use our services. Gdansk is the home of Service Management and is at the epicenter of how we manage our customers’ experience.

The Senior Site Reliability Engineer will analyze chronic and major issues, evaluate products and their services, make recommendations to improve service outcomes, design solutions in partnership with product, engineering, and architecture teams, build, test, operationalize tools and applications to improve customer experience and reduce costs.  Additionally, the Senior Site Reliability Engineer will assist in coaching to engineers and be an escalation for our global command center engineers. We have multiple opportunities at different levels of seniority.
Join our team today and you can bring your innovation, knowledge, and curiosity to create technology that powers the world’s most informed professionals.
responsibilities: Service design, service operations, release, development and support
Assisting with the work to drive efficiencies and reduce service operations risks.
Assisting with the research of new capabilities, testing new solutions, recommending and implementing new technologies to improve customer experience and reduce costs.
Collaborating and partnering with cross functional teams to solve intractable problems and devising solutions to improve the products and services we offer our customers.

offer_description: Poszukujemy Mid Software Engineera do nowego zespołu wytwórczego w Respect Energy - jest jedną z największych, niezależnych spółek na rynku energii elektrycznej w Polsce, która jako pierwsza zaoferowała swoim klientom w 100% zielony mix energetyczny, pochodzący z odnawialnych źródeł takich jak: słońce, wiatr, woda i biogaz.

Działalność Respect Energy opiera się na kilku filarach, m.in.: międzynarodowym obrocie energią elektryczną, prawami majątkowymi oraz gwarancjami pochodzenia, a także sprzedaży energii do odbiorców końcowych i działaniach promujących dostęp do czystej energii. Respect Energy inwestuje w infrastrukturę służącą do wytwarzania zielonej energii, głównie w farmy wiatrowe i fotowoltaiczne, poszerzając w ten sposób własne portfolio odnawialnych źródeł energii i rozbudowując ofertę dla klientów. Firma działa obecnie na 23 rynkach i współpracuje z grupą ponad 600 wytwórców energii.
Organizacja CICERO Shades of Green przyznała inwestycjom Respect Energy najwyższą notę CICERO Dark Green.

Ework Group - founded in 2000, listed on Nasdaq Stockholm, with around 13,000 independent professionals on assignment - we are the total talent solutions provider who partners with clients, in both the private and public sector, and professionals to create sustainable talent supply chains.

With a focus on IT/OT, R&D, Engineering and Business Development, we deliver sustainable value through a holistic and independent approach to total talent management. By providing comprehensive talent solutions, combined with vast industry experience and excellence in execution, we form successful collaborations. We bridge clients and partners & professionals throughout the talent supply chain, for the benefit of individuals, organizations and society.
For our client, a Danish company, we realize a recruitment process on the position System Specialist.
For Operation & Infrastructure Services division, Workplace Services department, company is looking for a talented System Specialist.

You will join the company and work within the M365 team (we’ll be 9 when you arrive). The team is situated in Warsaw and Copenhagen. We have been delivering M365 Services to our customers since 2018 and have a multitenant setup containing of 30+ tenants today. Our customers have the E3 license and focus is on the content of this, analysis on E5 is ongoing for future needs. As we deliver to the Banking industry there are extra focus on security, logging, compliance, and documentation. Daily work will focus on incidents and request sent in to our ITSM system (ServiceNow) and project work together with our customers.

Candidate will be involved in day-to-day operations supporting company’s stakeholders internal and external within the Microsoft 365 technology stack. You will be involved in designing and outlining new services offered to all company’s stakeholders.

Cooperation is a key part of the job as you will be in a situation where technology, knowledge/adoption and customer wishes are not all met in a perfect match. In this you alone or in cooperation with your team colleagues will find the best possible solution to a given request.

The Microsoft 365 Team in company have the mission to implement Microsoft Modern Work standards and principles. The ideal candidate keeps the mission of Modern Work and standards in mind when designing and doing day-to-day operations.
By active listening, corporation and your skills within the Microsoft cloud technology stack a solution is created and implemented.

offer_description: As a Digital Product Owner in the Data Organization, you will be a member of the Business Intelligence & Advanced Analytics Team.

In this role, you will define and control the technologies and processes of Data Visualization in Volvo Group. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to define the strategy and drive innovation.
Part of the Data unit within Volvo Digital & IT, Digital Product Owner for BI & Advanced Analytics, will be a central player in Volvo Data transformation journey.
responsibilities: Develop a clear vision for the Business Intelligence and Advanced Analytics function, aligning it with the organization's overall goals and objectives.
Take ownership of the end-to-end product lifecycle, from concept to delivery, ensuring that analytics products meet the needs of internal and external stakeholders.
Leverage your expertise with tools such as Power BI, Qlik, and Knime to design, implement, and maintain data-driven solutions.
Take ownership of the team backlog, prioritizing features, enhancements, and bug fixes based on business value and user needs.
Develop and maintain a clear roadmap for Data Visualization capabilities, ensuring alignment with the broader data strategy and objectives.
Secure that the team regularly collects feedback on implemented work.

offer_description: As an AI Engineer, you will work on developing a system for tagging video content using an invisible watermark generated by the platform. Your contribution to developing advanced algorithms and machine learning models will reduce the area over which the marking is applied. Thanks to the adaptive nature of where the marker is used, it will be much harder for the naked eye to detect it. In this way, we will ensure the preservation of the high-quality protected materials, minimizing the negative impact on their perception.

offer_description: Internal IT Project Medplanic => Roster Planning Software designed by anesthesiologists in Switzerland for hospitals. The system provides flexible multi-weekly availability patterns with unlimited number of preferences set for every single day in order to manage doctors working time. Implemented algorithm deals with sophisticated legal policies and handles individual plans of residents. The system has an intuitive user interface with drag and drop features. The absent days such as maternity or sick leaves can also be managed and reported. Medplanic automatically deals with the sudden and unexpected changes.

offer_description: Call with recruiter
Interview
Feedback and the decision
Let's meet in the office

It is always better to work with people you have met in person. That's why we invite you to come to one of our offices in Gdansk, Wroclaw or Warsaw, Lodz, Katowice and Krakow. We'll have the opportunity to show you our offices and complete your employment formalities.

We are looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer who will be part of the Data Science team working for various clients from huge Retailers, through aviation and manufacturing to producers of Whiskey. As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer in our growing Data & AI Guild, you will support our clients in solving their challenges within the context of the machine learning lifecycle - helping with things like data pre-processing, CI/CD for ML pipelines, etc.
This position provides development opportunities in various ML tools and technologies. If you like to have some space and independence, but also work in a team, then we are likely to cooperate well.
Recruitment steps:
responsibilities: Designing and implementing robust data pre-processing pipelines; the data can be structured or unstructured,

Identifying information gaps and looking for other data sets to fill them, which includes recognising issues with data quality and resolving them either by cleaning the data or suggesting process improvements,
Setting up machine learning development environments,
Ensuring code quality on production environments,
Building CI/CD/CT machine learning pipelines,
Collaborating with broader teams of data scientists and software developers to deliver complete software packages.
benefits: Only employees are entitled to benefits package
Contract for an indefinite period from day one
Working remotely or at the Gdańsk/Wrocław
Private medical care for you, your partner, kids
Multisport that can be exchanged for Cafeteria
~70 internal technical and soft skills trainings
English or German classes during working hours
33 days of sick-leave with 100% of salary
Development within working hours (8 day per year)

Dbamy o zdrowie i bezpieczeństwo - oferujemy pakiet medyczny i ubezpieczenie na życie dla Ciebie i Twoich bliskich, dostęp do platformy Mindgram z indywidualnymi konsultacjami ze specjalistami i webinariami. Pracując z nami masz też możliwość dołączenia do PPK i Programu Profilaktyki Onkologicznej.

Dla rodziców mamy dodatkowe dni urlopu macierzyńskiego i ojcowskiego oraz dni wolne na opiekę nad dzieckiem, niezależenie od wykorzystanego limitu przez drugiego rodzica.

Dołączając do nas decydujesz się na pracę w stabilnej i zorientowanej na komfortowe warunki pracy organizacji z certyfikatem Top Employer. Przyszłość to nasza wspólna inwestycja - razem z ING możesz zaangażować się w każdą inicjatywę wspierającą ESG i odpowiedzialność społeczną.
Świętujemy wspólnie i poznajemy się na zespołowych wyjazdach, imprezach rodzinnych i sportowych, jak Dzień Dziecka, Biegnij Warszawo czy Turnieje sportowe.

Technical talk. You will hear more about the product. You will present (be prepared!) Case Study of your favorite project, which should contain a short description of the problem and design process (30%) and a flow presentation of the main functionality of the digital product you designed (70%, UI-frames, screen after screen), shown on pixel-perfect design mockups.
30 minute final call

requirements_description: You have 3-5 years of experience in developing RPA processes using UiPath
You are ambitious, and what drives you is to show measurable results and create realizable savings through automation - together with the team
You focus on delivering efficient, scalable automated solutions and making sure they are reliable and easy to maintain
You develop robots to achieve the business goals set for the project with enthusiasm and aim that your solutions meet or even exceed the business expectations

UiPath Certified Advanced RPA Developer (UiARD) certification – more than welcome
Experience with SQL Server Management Studio, Azure DevOps, UiPath Cloud Platform
Technical knowledge of a scripting language or other relevant technology in integrations and infrastructure
A relevant higher education
Interested in learning new technologies and curious about new UiPath products
Ability to work independently in a well-organized manner
Familiarity with agile project management and Scrum framework

offer_description: Extended first aid course certificate (this is mandatory as a Falck employee)
Good discount deals on fuel, fitness, insurance etc.
Health insurance with access to all Falck's partners in Denmark
A career with real-life impact
Attractive terms of employment and a salary package that matches the requirements of the position and your qualifications – including good health and pension conditions
Flexible working conditions

As a Senior RPA Developer, you will be a part of Falck's RPA CoE in Digital Technology. You will be responsible for automating the largest and most complex processes across all Falck business units, globally.

Falck's RPA department currently consists of 13 employees and is part of the Data Platforms function, which consists of over 50 dedicated specialists with various skills in Data Engineering, Integrations, Power Platform, RPA and Master Data.

We have an informal tone, a strong team spirit and good cross-functional cooperation. We are physically located in Copenhagen, Aarhus and in Warsaw in Poland, where there may be travel activity between the locations so that you can get closer to your colleagues and business partners.

You will quickly get a great deal of responsibility in delivering complex projects from our RPA pipeline, and you will be specializing in developing exciting automations when working closely with RPA Business Analysts and always counting on support of RPA Manager and Technical Lead, with initiatives at tactical and operational level that can reach across Falck's entire organization.

As a Center of Excellence, we have ambitions to always use the most technically advanced solutions, deliver more intelligent automations in the future and as we are deeply committed to UiPath, we have a strong interest in keeping up with new products and releases.

With us, you get an exciting job in a department that Falck has an incredible focus on and the opportunity to turn your ideas into reality. You will be a part of a team with a high ceiling that values professionalism and collaboration. We make sure that our colleagues thrive, are challenged and have the opportunity to develop their potential.

If you have a course or a technology that you would like to learn more about, it will become part of your development plan. As part of Data Platforms, you will also have colleagues who are all specialists in their respective technologies, always ready to spar or learn themselves.
In addition, Falck offers:
responsibilities: Design, develop, test and deploy RPA solutions in close collaboration with RPA business analysts and business stakeholders
Document the RPA solutions in all its technical aspects
Monitor and maintain automations post-implementation and resolve any potential issues to ensure smooth business operations
Perform various RPA Center of Excellence activities, such as setting up, using and maintaining UiPath infrastructure, including virtual machines and SQL databases
Leverage different capabilities of the UiPath Cloud Platform, e.g. Orchestrator, Apps, Admin and automate using the newest UiPath Studio versions
Work with IT stakeholders possessing different skillsets and be able to leverage the most technically efficient solutions for process automation (e.g. APIs, databases)

Networking Concepts: You should have a strong understanding of networking fundamentals such as TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, routing, switching, and load balancing.

Automation: You should have experience with automation tools like Azure Resource Manager, PowerShell, and Azure CLI.
Hybrid Networking: You should understand hybrid networking architectures such as Azure ExpressRoute, Site-to-Site VPN, Point-to-Site VPN and AWS Direct connect.
Cloud Networking Design: You should have experience in designing cloud networking architectures that are highly available, scalable, and secure.
Troubleshooting: You should be able to troubleshoot network issues using tools like Azure Network Watcher and other diagnostic tools.
DevOps: You should be able to work closely with DevOps teams to design and implement networking solutions that are compatible with continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines.

The Hybrid Cloud Networking Product Owner will be part of a team which designs and develops the architecture of cloud networking products that meet customer needs, scalable, and reliable. The ideal candidate for this role will have IT infrastructure experience in both Cloud and On-premises network architecture and administration. The role will require the candidate to provide technical expertise to build product features in and around cloud/on-premises networking services to solve a set of business requirements. The role also requires strategic planning and delivery of networking products/services and features which enable organization goals including cost savings, high availability, disaster recovery, increase in speed of product, reduction in time to delivery, network platform documentation, leadership of the networking Operations team, agile management of work delivery, knowledge base creation, and excellent communication.

At Siemens Healthineers, we take into account different perspectives, are open to dialogue and challenge conventions. Change is an integral part of our work. We strive to be a leader of change in our industry, not just to respond to them. We invite you to take on new challenges with us, test your ideas and celebrate successes.

We highly value diversity, inclusion and equal opportunities, so we warmly invite everyone, regardless of their gender identity, to apply for this position. We also encourage people with disabilities to apply.
At  you will find additional information about our areas of ​​activities.

We care about data privacy and take it seriously in accordance with the GDPR and other regulations related to personal data protection. For this reason, please do not send us your CV or other application documents by e-mail. Instead, please create your profile on our Career Portal  which allows you to submit your documents, apply for open positions and to obtain information about our vacancies and career development at Siemens.
responsibilities: As a Hybrid Cloud Networking Product Owner, your primary responsibility is to lead the development and management of the networking product roadmap for Hybrid cloud infrastructure. Here are some specific responsibilities:

Develop and manage the product roadmap: Based on the product vision and strategy, the product owner should create a detailed roadmap that outlines the features and functionalities that will be developed and when they will be released.

Gather and prioritize requirements: The product owner should work with stakeholders, customers, and internal teams to identify and prioritize the features and functionalities that are needed in the product.

Designing product architecture: You will be responsible for designing the architecture of cloud networking products, including defining the high-level system architecture and ensuring that it is scalable, reliable, and meets customer needs.
Manage the product backlog: The product owner should maintain a prioritized backlog of features and functionalities that need to be developed and communicate this to the development team.

Developing technical specifications: You will develop technical specifications that describe the product architecture, including the overall system design, component architecture, and software design.

At Tanium, our Support Engineer fulfills a necessary role in our organization to serve our customers by resolving technical issues and answering technical questions that customers have in a timely manner. With a primary focus on customer satisfaction, Support Engineers work both reactively and proactively to improve the overall experience of our enterprise customers when using Tanium. This role will report to a Support Manager. As a Support Engineer, you’ll have continuous opportunities to apply your best technical skills while building new skills ranging from scripting to debugging.
responsibilities: Assisting customers by:
Triaging inbound support cases
Solving customer support cases
Working with other Support Engineers to assist with their assigned cases
Answering customer questions in the Tanium community site
Improve customer experience by:

requirements_description: At least 3 years of experience in sales (preferably within the technology sector or startup ecosystem).
Excellent command of English, both written & spoken (C1 minimum).
Experience in working with international clients (US, Nordics, DACH are an additional advantage).

Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills to effectively engage with diverse teams, stakeholders and the ability to clearly articulate complex solutions and value propositions. Additionally, an ability to gather client needs and to set clear project expectations.
Ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams, including sales, marketing, product development, and engineering, to craft customized solutions addressing specific client needs.
Experience in creating and presenting offers, as well as adept negotiation skills for securing deals and contract terms.
Self-starter mentality with a passion for technology and entrepreneurship, fostering the ability to adapt to changing market conditions and client requirements.

Occasionally, we need to travel to vibrant cities like San Francisco or New York. So if you have a passion for exploring new destinations and thrive on face-to-face interactions with clients, this is an advantage.
Having expertise in client acquisition strategies and the ability to tap into your existing network would be awesome.
offer_description: We are Tooploox and we work on projects that
- in line with our mission, we have already changed the way people invest their money, build houses and take care of their health (just take a look at our client portfolio).
Feel invited!

We're in search of an Account Manager (Deal Closer) with a zeal for technological entrepreneurship and a knack for deal closure. Acting as the vital link between Tooploox and our partners, your primary focus will be to cultivate relationships with these organizations, understand their vision, and align our services to fast-track their growth from concept to industry leader.
responsibilities: Build Relationship: Engage with the startups ecosystem to develop and maintain strong, long-lasting client relationships with founders and key decision-makers.

Tailor Solutions: Work in tandem with our product and development teams to design cutting-edge, bespoke solutions that not only meet but exceed client expectations, driving their growth and positioning us at the forefront of industry innovation.
Deal Closure: Focus on the later stages of the sales cycle, skillfully handling the negotiations and closing deals, making sure there’s a clear alignment between clients’ needs and our goals.
Client Advocacy: Serve as the client's voice within our organization, relaying insights and feedback to shape future product developments.

Growth Blueprinting: Collaborate with our sales and marketing teams to develop and refine sales strategies, optimize processes, and identify opportunities for expansion into new markets, ensuring our approach remains innovative and effective.
Market Intelligence: Stay updated on emerging trends in the tech world, providing our product development teams with insights to ensure our offerings remain ahead of the curve.

offer_description: Elastyczną formę współpracy - B2B/UZ
Pracę w nowoczesnym biurze w centrum Wrocławia
Dużą decyzyjność w organizacji własnej pracy
Ciekawą pracę w stabilnej, dynamicznie rozwijającej się firmie otwartej na ludzi i nowe pomysły
Możliwość rozwoju własnych kompetencji i budowania pozycji eksperta dzięki atrakcyjnym wyzwaniom
Przyjazną atmosferę i niezbędne narzędzia pracy
Jesteśmy zespołem inżynierów z

, z siedzibą w centrum Wrocławia. Specjalizujemy się w projektowaniu i rozwijaniu innowacyjnych urządzeń hardware z elementami IoT, które integrujemy z oprogramowaniem. W ten sposób tworzymy zarówno unikalne produkty wewnętrzne, jak i rozwiązania dla naszych klientów.

Nasze dotychczasowe realizacje obejmują m.in. "efectivo" - system czujników monitorujących magazyny i centra produkcyjne, umożliwiający optymalizację zarządzania zasobami w czasie rzeczywistym. Kolejnym projektem jest "kocoach.tech" - inteligentny worek treningowy, który jest połączony z aplikacją mobilną, rewolucjonizującym trening poprzez personalizację i monitorowanie postępów.

Nasz zespół składa się z utalentowanych inżynierów, którzy tworzą realne rozwiązania dla rzeczywistych problemów. Nasze produkty wyróżniają się dzięki kombinacji umiejętności technicznych oraz pomysłowości. Naszym celem jest kontynuowanie pracy nad innowacyjnymi projektami, które przyczyniają się do pozytywnego wpływu na życie ludzi.

Zapotrzebowanie w projektach stale się zwiększa. Aktualnie poszukujemy osoby, która dołączy do naszego zespołu jako niezależny/-a ekspert/-ka. Twoje działania będą opierać się na zleceniach, w zależności od pozyskania kontraktu na montaż naszego produktu "efectivo GEO".
Jeśli chcesz być kluczową częścią rozwijającego się biznesu, ta rola może być dla Ciebie!

requirements_description: Master's Degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics or a related;
At least 6 to 8 years' experience in finance, preferably in international company from IT sector (
Accounting background, gained in e.g. Big4, accounting office, internal accounting department, knowledge and understanding of accounting principles, financial regulations and tax laws;
Solid experience in controlling, including budgeting, forecasting, financial planning, reporting and analysis;
Experience in change management, especially process and tools optimization, standardisation and unification, would be highly appreciated;

offer_description: Professional development within international organization from IT sector;
Unique opportunity to contribute to the company growth with high business exposure;
Real chance to take a part in both functional and cross-functional projects, including post-acquisition business integration;
Competitive salary (contract of employment/B2B), benefit package, collaborative and innovative work environment.

Our Client is an international IT company operating in B2B sector. Due to its further growth in Poland (new acquisition) we are looking for a Candidate to hold the newly created role of Finance Manager.

The Finance Manager plays a pivotal role in an organisation, responsible for overseeing and managing all financial aspects to ensure the company's fiscal health and sustainability. This position requires a strong grasp of financial principles, strategic thinking and effective operational performance.
responsibilities: Financial Planning and Analysis: Develop, implement, and manage financial plans, budgets, and forecasts. Analyze financial data to provide insights and recommendations for improving financial performance;

Financial Reporting: Prepare accurate and timely financial reports, including income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements. Ensure compliance with accounting standards and regulatory requirements;
Budget Management: Monitor and control budgets, identifying areas for cost reduction and efficiency improvement. Collaborate with department heads to align budgets with organizational goals;
Risk Management: Assess and mitigate financial risks by implementing sound risk management practices. Develop and maintain internal controls to safeguard company assets;
Cash Flow Management: Manage cash flow to meet operational needs and optimize investment opportunities. Maintain banking relationships and oversee cash management activities.
Financial Strategy: Collaborate with senior management to develop and execute financial strategies aligned with the company's objectives. Provide financial insights to support decision-making.

We offer security and systems management solutions that enable enterprises to oversee and safeguard their IT infrastructures. Capco Poland is a global technology and management consultancy specializing in driving digital transformation across the financial services industry. We are passionate about helping our clients succeed in an ever-changing industry. We also are experts in banking and payments, capital markets, wealth and asset management focused on maintaining our nimble, agile, and entrepreneurial culture.

We are looking for experienced individuals to join our clients' Group Transformation Office as Process Experts to drive and execute the overall strategic transformation agenda and Operational Excellence Ways of Working (OE WOW) as well as provide process re-engineering, structural changes, digitization, policy streamlining, targets and tracking, training, and accountability.
responsibilities: Providing the Operational Excellence Ways of Working (OE WOW) including OE framework development and launch, execution of process improvement programs, the launch of process management / WOW practices, and benefits realization
Identifying process optimization opportunities and aligning priorities with regional and local stakeholders
Building, developing, and maintaining the relationship with stakeholders

Supporting the development and maintenance of standards and guidelines in line with the OE WOW frameworks (e.g. process universe, process governance and roles, definition and usage of e2e process KPIs, target setting, and benefit tracking)
Sharing learnings from process improvement programs and providing inputs to the global design of target modular processes and customer journeys
Developing capabilities and skills of business owners, process owners, process participants, and 2nd and 3rd LOD in the practice of process management and improvements

requirements_description: A minimum of 5 of experience in DevOps roles, with a proven track record of managing and leading teams.
Extensive experience with Azure Cloud services and a deep understanding of cloud architecture and best practices.
Proficiency in scripting and automation tools (e.g., PowerShell, Python, Ansible, Terraform).
Strong experience in setting up and optimizing CI/CD pipelines using tools like Jenkins, GitLab CI, or Azure DevOps.
In-depth knowledge of containerization technologies (e.g., Docker) and container orchestration platforms (e.g., Kubernetes).
Familiarity with monitoring tools (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana, Datadog) and logging solutions (e.g., ELK stack).
Security and Compliance: Understanding of security best practices and experience implementing compliance measures in a cloud environment.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to lead and inspire a team towards shared goals.
offer_description: The DevOps Lead plays a pivotal role in our organization, overseeing a team of DevOps engineers distributed across product teams. This role requires a seasoned professional with extensive experience in cloud technologies, particularly in Azure Cloud. The DevOps Lead is responsible for driving the overall uplift of our organization's cloud capabilities, ensuring seamless integration of development and operations, and fostering a culture of continuous improvement.
responsibilities: Lead and mentor a team of DevOps engineers, providing guidance, support, and professional development opportunities.
Collaborate closely with product teams to understand their specific DevOps requirements and facilitate the integration of DevOps processes into their workflows.
Leverage deep knowledge of Azure Cloud services to optimize infrastructure, enhance scalability, and ensure robust security practices.
Drive the automation of deployment, monitoring, and scaling processes to enhance efficiency and reliability.
Implement and refine CI/CD pipelines to accelerate development cycles and maintain high-quality code standards.
Establish and manage monitoring systems to proactively identify and address potential issues, ensuring system availability and performance.

offer_description: Opportunity to shape the sales function within a growing company.
Additional performance-based incentives.
Collaborative and supportive work environment.
Professional growth opportunities.
Flexible work arrangements.

We are a forward-thinking software house that specializes in developing innovative mobile solutions for our clients. With a team of dedicated professionals, we are committed to delivering high-quality software products. As we expand our horizons, we are excited to introduce a new role for an IT Business Development Manager to join our team and play a pivotal role in driving our company's growth.

We are seeking an accomplished and motivated person to lead our sales initiatives. The ideal candidate will possess a combination of strategic thinking, relationship-building skills, and a deep understanding of technology sales. This role offers an opportunity to shape the sales function, foster client relationships, and contribute to the success of our software solutions.
Benefits:

If you are an experienced and driven IT Business Development looking to make a significant impact in a small software house environment, we invite you to apply and join our team. Let's work together to drive our company's growth by forging strong client relationships and delivering outstanding software solutions.
responsibilities: Develop and execute a comprehensive sales strategy aligned with company goals to drive revenue growth and market penetration.
Identify and target potential clients through research, networking, and market analysis to expand the company's client base.
Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with existing and potential clients, understanding their needs and proposing tailored software solutions.
Manage the sales pipeline, including lead generation, qualification, proposal submission, and contract negotiation.
Work closely with the technical teams to ensure a unified approach and alignment between sales and overall company objectives.
Stay updated on industry trends, competitors, and emerging technologies to effectively position our software solutions.

Poszukujemy Starszego Kierownika Modernizacji Oprogramowania do prowadzenia organizacji zajmującej się modernizacją/migracją produktów Symfonii do chmury publicznej.

W Symfonii łączymy to co najlepsze w naszych aplikacjach z nowoczesną technologią. W tym celu prowadzimy szereg inicjatyw dotyczących modernizacji aplikacji desktopowych, sprawdzonych u tysięcy naszych klientów. Modernizacje te nakierowane są na udostępnienie w chmurze funkcjonalności wspierających codzienną pracę biur rachunkowych oraz małych i średnich przedsiębiorstw. Zajmujemy się badaniem, rozwojem i wdrażaniem technologii przyspieszających modernizacje oprogramowania i bazy danych tak, aby funkcjonalności aplikacji desktopowych były dostępne w chmurze publicznej. W ten sposób łączymy to co najlepsze w naszych aplikacjach z tym co najefektywniejsze w technologii.
Gotowa/y na wyzwania? Ta oferta jest dla Ciebie!
Chcesz dowiedzieć się więcej? Zapraszamy do aplikowania!
responsibilities: Realizacja strategii firmy w zakresie modernizacji desktop i przenoszenia do chmury

Are you passionate about building some of the world’s best loved brands? Do you want to gain work experience with the company that invented the concept of brands and brand management?

Over the years, we have remained consistently state of the art in marketing, always finding new and exciting ways to reach consumers, from the classic store to the most sophisticated digital technology. This is why some of the best marketing pros and business leaders started with us.

If you are a university student or fresh graduate with strong dedication to lead, a hunger to learn, a thirst to overcome barriers, a ceaseless passion to win, and an interest in pursuing a career at P&G – this traineeship is for you! You will dive right in on one of our world-class brands, developing marketing plans and identifying specific marketing tactics to build on consumer, shopper and customer insights. Your expertise and creative tactics will help win the devotion of our consumers and grow our brands. Together, we will continue to build the world’s leading brand experiences and make a difference for nearly 125 million consumers in Central Europe. Pretty cool, right?

: 32-40 h/week within office hours

offer_description: We are seeking talents to our Warsaw office for the position of
80% - 100% with flexible working hours;
12 month
1st quarter of 2024
Do you want to join us and learn from one of the top Commercial organizations in the world?

At Procter & Gamble, we are proud to say that we develop talents almost exclusively from within. This means we are not offering you your first job out of university, we are hiring you with the expectations you will grow into one of our future leaders - maybe even our next CEO.

We are the world's largest consumer goods company with operations in 80 countries, more than 80 billion US$ in revenues and with 25 Billion-Dollar Brands, such as Gillette, Ariel, Pantene, Old Spice, Always, Lenor, Pampers, Vizir, Fairy and Oral-b.

Our Traineeship program provides you an unusual opportunity to join our best-in-class Central European Commercial team for 12 months with the intention to provide you with on-the-job training and a job offer for a managerial position (Sales Manager) upon successful completion of your Traineeship.

From day one you will be co-leading our business at one of our main customers (retailers).You will learn how to develop, negotiate and execute sales and marketing strategies based on in-depth customer, market and trade analysis.

We are looking for our next generation of talented leaders, to develop and flourish in a long-term career with us. You will receive in-depth, industry leading and one-to-one training, as well as mentoring from your line manager and other colleagues, ensuring that you can succeed and develop from day one.
The Commercial Traineeship Program consists of two phases:

Already in the first phase of your journey, you are fully responsible for your own accounts within the Commercial Force. You will influence in-store promotions, executions, visibility and sufficient stock level.
You will co-lead the business with one of our retailer as a Key Account Manager responsible for a category or a customer.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status or disability status.
responsibilities: Participating in accelerated On-the-job and classroom trainings to develop your personal a professional skills and capabilities
Being supported in independent decision-making and risk taking
Having an opportunity for a managerial role upon the successful completion of the Traineeship program
Enjoying an attractive salary (9300 PLN gross/month for full working time) and benefit package
Receiving a pool car and iPhone to support you in your daily responsibilities
Being invited to join regular Commercial offsite meetings and business travels across Europe

offer_description: We design, deploy, and manage applications and infrastructure that supports Akamai's internal and customer-facing cloud storage platforms. We do this while maintaining Akamai's mission to make life better for billions of people, billions of times a day.

As a Site Reliability Engineer - Storage, you'll collaborate with operations and development teams to build and manage our scalable storage platforms, including Block Storage, Object Storage, and backups. You'll create tooling to automate the lifecycle of petabyte-scale storage systems. You'll work with open-source technologies, including Ceph, to ensure Akamai's storage systems are reliable, available, and performant.
responsibilities: Architecting new highly available storage systems and infrastructure, supporting a variety of workloads from compute customers
Automating complex workflows and new deployments with Bash/Python and Saltstack/Ansible, increasing the reliability of our storage platforms
Engaging and networking with Ceph developers and users, contributing back to the open-source community
Identifying bottlenecks within the OSI model, improving performance and reliability wherever possible in software and hardware
Tuning Ceph, the Linux kernel, and server hardware, maximizing performance for our customers
Testing and deploying new Ceph features, releases, and bug fixes; automating regression testing for components within our storage platform

offer_description: At Tangora / Idea North we are currently looking for the right person to fill in as our low-code platform implementation specialist.

OK, so low-code in our terms means joining basic blocks to build complex web applications right in the browser, yeep, browser. It is the primary tool we use. We developed a bit of software within which (using browsers of course) you can create databases, scripts, create layouts for sites, pages, web components, etc. you name it, all using standard blocks. It is really fun! And it is blazin’ fast to work with!
Tangora is a Danish company, and as Danes we love hygge! But to hygge-all-day we needed to simplify our work, and that’s how our low-code platform was conceived!

Idea North is a branch of Tangora that operates in Poland, Wrocław, and we do love hygge, probably even more than Danes! So if you are looking to work in a hygge-like environment, drinking specialty coffee all day, doing some keyboard-typing and mouse-clicking whilst creating exciting apps, then… Do we need to elaborate further? Oh, and there’s no client meetings, none, zip, nada, null… Hygge!

Initially you’ll be tasked with getting yourself familiar with our low-code platform. We will answer all your questions and after a short period of time our project managers will start throwing some smaller tasks at you. You’ll get a chance to meet them in person at some point, they might pop in at our office or you’ll be traveling to theirs, but most of the time you’ll be exchanging comments in Asana or Teams. Some Teams meetings are unavoidable, but we are trying to reduce the time spent on these to a minimum. Hygge!

We’ll teach you everything there is to know about our low-code platform, all you’ll need to bring is fluent English (in writing/speaking), some understanding of HTML, CSS and basic JS to the table, and we’ll take it from there. Of course your previous experience with databases, web applications, accessibility is always a plus.

Typically our employees are happy to work with us for 8-10 years and more! It is because we care about them. For starters you’ll get whatever hardware you want to work with, laptop, extra monitor or two, decent headphones, keyboard and mouse of your choice, own coffee mug, etc. and after probation period we’ll get you on board with a permanent job contract. Did we mention nice salary brackets to start with and annual reviews? Hygge!

Our Poland offices are located in the south-west Wrocław, in a convenient spot, not too far from the city center, but not directly in, so you can typically avoid traffic getting in and out. There are buses, trams and trains close by, but not too close, you can’t actually hear these. Driving a car? No problem, there are plenty of free parking spots around. Not a fan of bringing your own food to work? We got you covered, there are some convenient stores around and some restaurants not too far. And we have specialty coffee at hand in the office. You can bring your plant to join other green colleagues in the office. Hygge!
responsibilities: Creating solutions using our low-code platform

offer_description: Hybrid model with two first weeks on-site in the office in Warsaw (onboarding), during next 2 months - 2 days in the office per week. After probation period - once a week/month in the office (a matter of agreement).
Our core product is working from 2012. Wonga is working in Agile environment – Product and DevOps teams are using SCRUM. We have working CI/CD process, many test environments, few tech teams.

Our infrastructure is hybrid and base on AWS and On-Prem Datacenter. We have Linux and Windows environments that we automate with Ansible and Terraform. We cooperate with partners to use best practices in our infrastructure development. We monitor all our systems deeply and have a good visibility of systems health. We manage infrastructure with automation that helps us to scale and change fast.
DevOps Team connects Product Teams (Dev, QA, PMs) with technology and cooperates with IT and InfoSec teams.

We look for experienced DevOps engineer that might have some past Software development experience. That person will work on new products infrastructure rollout from test environments to production and will help to change an architecture of the current platform to meet faster scale, less incidents and better cost efficiency. In the meanwhile all core systems must be stable, so DevOps engineer will also work with the team on maintenance projects to do refactorings, automate OPS processes and update the toolset we use.

Are you looking to take your career to the next level? At Procter & Gamble, we are proud to say that we develop talents almost exclusively from within. This means we are not just offering you your first job out of university; we are hiring you with the expectation you will grow into one of our future leaders - maybe even our next CEO.
This is an extraordinary opportunity to join P&G HR Department in P&G Central Europe Headquarter in Warsaw. Are you ready for a new challenge? We certainly are!

Commitment from us P&G’s Day 1 starts with you doing something that matters – making an impact on the world, P&G brands, and your career. You’ll be at the core of life-changing innovations, be given exciting projects, lead initiatives, and take ownership and responsibility. And you will do this in creative workspaces where new ideas thrive. All the while, you’ll receive best-in-class training to help you become a leader in your field. And it’s not just about what you’ll do, but how you’ll feel: welcomed, valued, purposeful, challenged, heard, encouraged, and inspired.

Who we are? P&G was founded over 180 years ago as a simple soap and candle company. Today, we’re the world’s largest consumer goods company and home to iconic, trusted brands that make life a little bit easier in small but important ways. We’ve spanned three centuries thanks to three simple ideas: leadership, innovation, and citizenship. The insight, innovation and passion of hardworking teams has helped us grow into a global company that is governed responsibly and ethically, that is open, translucent, and that supports good causes and protects the environment.

P&G is committed to providing equal opportunities in employment. We value diversity, and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

requirements_description: 3+ years of professional software development experience specific to .NET in Agile methodology.
Strong understanding of the software development life cycle (SDLC) and software architectures (web applications, micro-services and cloud-native applications are desirable).
Excellent working knowledge of programming in C# with frameworks .NET (6.0+) and .NET Core (2.0+).
Extensive knowledge and experience in building GraphQL APIs (Apollo, Apollo Federation, HC) and REST APIs.
Practical experience with logging and monitoring tools like Elastic, Kibana, Grafana and Dynatrace.
Working experience in Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment activities especially with AzureDevOps and GIT code repositories.
Ideally some experience with containers (Docker) and containerized platforms (Kubernetes, AKS).
Working experience with Jira / Confluence etc. related tooling for modern software engineering.
Practical experience with building UIs with JavaScript frameworks and libraries (ideally ReactNative, Svelte) is a plus.
Understanding of public cloud (Azure) is desirable in the areas of network topology, storage, computation, and security, including:
Authentication and authorization
Functional based / asynchronous programming / Serverless architecture
Good knowledge of English in speaking and writing.

As innovators in the omnichannel retail space, Qurate is always looking for new and exciting ways to interact with our customers. We are forward-looking and dedicated to revolutionizing the shopping experience for our customers. With a strong focus on our streaming TV initiatives, we are strategically investing in the development of new platforms to bring groundbreaking shopping experiences to our customers on whichever device they choose to engage with.

As a Software Engineer .NET, you will play a key role in supporting our expanded reach initiatives, with a particular emphasis on the streaming TV aspect. You'll collaborate with a group of highly talented software engineers and IT partners to deliver next-generation applications that will shape the future of retail.

Imagine a shopping experience where customers can seamlessly browse, discover, and purchase products directly through their TVs, set-top boxes, and smart devices. We want to disrupt the traditional shopping landscape and lead the industry into the future, providing our customers with an immersive and unparalleled shopping journey.

This role offers a truly unique and exciting opportunity for someone with a passion for technology and a desire to innovate. You'll be at the forefront of creating cutting-edge solutions that will transform how people shop, making it not just convenient but also enjoyable and interactive. Join us in this extraordinary endeavor to change the way the world shops and be part of a team that's set to redefine the future of retail through streaming TV and beyond.

Founded in 2017, Unit8 is a fast-growing Swiss AI and data analytics consulting and services company dedicated to solving complex problems of traditional industries like automotive, chemical, financial services, manufacturing and pharma. We work with some of the biggest organisations in Europe to solve the challenges that directly affect their business - be it operations, finance, manufacturing or R&D. Since our foundation, we have successfully delivered more than 135 projects and have grown to 100+ talented individuals across 5 office locations.

Unit8’s mission is to drive the adoption of AI and Data Science in the non-digital industries and to help accelerate their digital transformation. Among its activities, Unit8 dedicates a part of its resources and time on projects that deeply matter to us - that includes collaboration on pro-bono and “engineering for good” causes. You can learn more about what we are passionate about at Unit8 Talks and on our website you can find more useful information about our business and recruiting process.

offer_description: At Zowie, we believe that buying online should feel like walking into your favorite local shop: personal, friendly, and easy. Our mission is to recreate offline shopping experiences online - but better. Zowie brings speed and empathy to customer interactions!
🚀 Growing fast. We plan on keeping the Team growing! You’ll have a lot of autonomy and impact as we grow.
🏈 Like a sports team. We take ownership of our work and believe in personal accountability. At the same time, we work together, support each other, and focus on winning as a team.

🧑‍💻 Remote-first and hours are flexible. We allow everyone to figure out the best ways to collaborate with their team. At the end of the day, it's about delivering! Those in Poland can work from our offices in Cracow and Warsaw.
💪 Ambitious and innovative. We don’t settle on existing solutions and keep looking for better ways to tackle challenges.👻 Bold and free-thinking. We trust our employees to find the best solutions.
🤸‍♀️Agile and high-performing. We work smarter, not harder. We use our OKRs to keep ourselves focused.
🤠 Unafraid of change. Zowie is growing quickly. We thrive in an ever-evolving environment.
You’re a part of our company’s future success.
We trust each other and don’t count days.
We spend time together in person to strengthen our team.
We offer an additional health insurance package.
We want to grow personally and professionally together.
Make yourself a comfy space for work on a daily basis.
responsibilities: As a Machine learning engineer, you are going to work on building our competitive advantage: Zowie X1. It begins by utilizing LLMs to optimize intent recognition, facilitate content creation, identify customer buying intentions, and provide sales assistance, among other functions.

Your job will combine fine-tuning models, researching the best products that we can leverage, and solid engineering that includes deployment, retraining, or monitoring the quality of our AI work. You are going to partner with another Machine Learning engineer and collaborate with a TL who has strong AI & NLP acumen.

We have a strong vision of software helping to deliver amazing customer service experiences, and AI is a core factor in it. Since those projects are our strategic investment, you will also collaborate directly with Michał - our VP of Engineering, and Maciej - Zowie’s Co-Founder, to figure out the best strategy forward.

In the end, your job leads to the value we bring to our users. It’s not about synthetic research but about iteratively delivering impactful improvements to our users' daily work and their customers' experience.

jest szybko rozwijającą się firmą w obszarze technologii, która łączy w sobie energię startupu i ambicje dojrzałej firmy. offer_description: We’re Kingfisher. You might know us as Castorama, B&Q, Screwfix, Brico Depot or Koçtaş. We’re made up of over 78,000 passionate people, call over 1,300 stores home and operate in 8 countries. That’s right, we’re big, but we have ambitions to become even bigger and even better. We want to become the leading home improvement company and grow the largest community of home improvers in the world. And that’s where you come in.

At Kingfisher our customers come from all walks of life, and so do we. We want to ensure that all colleagues, future colleagues, and applicants to Kingfisher are treated equally regardless of age, gender, marital or civil partnership status, colour, ethnic or national origin, culture, religious belief, philosophical belief, political opinion, disability, gender identity, gender expression or sexual orientation.

We are going through an exciting period of change and are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Frontend Engineer to join our Software Engineering team. As a Software Engineer, you will work closely with your cross-functional team to design and implement new features and products and act as the driving force within the Engineering team to ensure these are developed successfully. Our aspiration is to grow an engineering function that is world-class, pioneering in the retail technology space, and making great software within a growth culture that is always looking for the next thing to improve or adapt to meet our customer's needs.
If you're looking for an exciting opportunity to step out of your comfort zone and make a real impact by building better software, this is the job for you!

. The successful candidate will manage our two offices in Poland (Katowice and Poznan) and will be responsible for ad-hoc HR related processes in the Polish branch.

OpenSky is a dynamic, exciting place to work. We hire exceptional people, and every one of them is empowered to think independently, take initiative and be innovative in their job. We’ve built a truly unique culture here at OpenSky, where our employees are always learning, challenged with interesting projects and rewarded with fantastic benefits. We attract talented individuals from a wide range of cultural, geographic and educational backgrounds whom bring with them a rich variety of skills and experiences.

company_description: Motorola, then called Galvin Manufacturing Corporation, was established in 1928. Long tradition helps us meet high-quality standards not only in providing the best products and solutions but also in providing the best work environment for our employees.

Motorola Solutions is the leader in the telecommunications industry. We provide innovative products, services, and solutions that play an essential role in the public safety area. Our systems and devices are used by police, firefighters, emergency medical services, and also by clients from the private sector.

To our clients all over the globe, we deliver communication networks, applications, and services which are intuitive and which allow for the data to be transferred instantly and safely, and we arm them with nearly indestructible radios and devices.
Our first office in Poland was set up over 25 years ago. Now we hire more than 1700 people and the Cracow R&D Center is Motorola’s biggest innovation center.
Here your job really matters.

Wierzymy, że będąc osobą w tej roli nadal stawiasz na swój rozwój. Chcemy Ci w tym pomóc, więc oferujemy wiele możliwości doskonalenia umiejętności adekwatnych do pełnionej roli (szkolenia, warsztaty wewnętrzne i zewnętrzne), w tym:

Jeśli Twoje doświadczenie będzie szło w parze z naszymi potrzebami, podczas krótkiej rozmowy telefonicznej zadamy Ci kilka pytań o Twoje doświadczenie i motywację. Kolejno zaprosimy Cię na rozmowę rekrutacyjną z Grzegorzem z domeny AUD oraz Karoliną lub Julią - IT Rekruterkami. Jeśli pojawią się kwestie, które wymagać będą dodatkowego doprecyzowania zorganizujemy drugą - tym razem krótszą - rozmowę. Po kilku dniach wracamy z decyzją i całościowym feedbackiem.
Jeśli jesteś analitykiem biznesowym, który potrafi gromadzić wymagania biznesowe i wspierać klientów w zdefiniowaniu wizji produktu - dołącz do naszego zespołu!

Od 2016 roku nieustannie rośniemy: Clutch, Deloitte i Financial Times uznały nas za jedną z najszybciej rozwijających się firm w Europie. Z utalentowanymi specjalistami na pokładzie, budujemy produkty cyfrowe dla takich firm jak National Geographic czy Paradox Interactive. Naszym celem jest tworzenie wysokiej jakości aplikacji mobilnych i desktopowych, między innymi w branży FinTech, MedTech, fashion czy gamingowej. Sprawdź opinie o nas na Clutch.co.

Szukamy osoby, która dołączy do teamu Analysis, User & Design i będzie łącznikiem świata biznesu i naszych zespołów produktowych. Szukamy osoby komunikatywnej, gracza zespołowego, który lubi pracować z ludźmi. Twoje umiejętności analitycznego myślenia, motywacja i duże zdolności organizacyjne będą docenione przez Twój zespół.

offer_description: We are looking for a dedicated and skilled
to join our client’s dynamic team. In this role, you will be instrumental in developing and maintaining the core backend infrastructure that powers their innovative products and services.

Over the past two decades, there has been a remarkable surge in novel payment services, encompassing digital wallets, mobile payments, open banking, Buy Now Pay Later, and cryptocurrency solutions. While advantageous for consumers, these innovations have posed challenges for merchants and developers. Our client’s solution tackles this complexity by offering a pioneering automation platform for payments. They provide merchants and developers with essential infrastructure and modular tools to enhance customer purchasing experiences. Their platform fosters easy connections, enabling merchants to effortlessly access the services they need via an intuitive dashboard. Since its inception in January 2020, our client has secured funding from prominent investors and assembled a team with diverse expertise in payments and fintech.
responsibilities: Build 3-rd party payment integrations into our client’s product, ensuring the security, accuracy, and reliability of financial transactions
Prepare technical design, develop, and maintain robust and scalable backend systems using Python 3.9+
Implement and maintain various API frameworks, including REST, XML-based, and GraphQL
Ensure code quality by adding unit, integration, and end-to-end tests
Create and maintain an  internal and external technical documentation
Participate in architectural discussions and contribute to the continuous improvement of our software development processes
benefits: Flexible working hours and remote work possibility

Od 1976 roku rozwijamy się w dziedzinie produkcji włóknin, które dostarczamy wiodącym markom z branży higienicznej, medycznej, a także obuwniczej oraz odzieżowej. Pięć dekad na zielonogórskim rynku pracy pozwoliło nam zbudować wizerunek rzetelnego pracodawcy i zdobyć zaufanie mieszkańców miasta. Jesteśmy liderem w swojej dziedzinie i jednym z niewielu zakładów na terenie Polski z tak wieloletnią tradycją. Dzięki temu jesteśmy w stanie zaoferować naszym pracownikom stabilne zatrudnienie, zdobywanie nieprzeciętnych umiejętności i budowanie kariery w dziedzinie o wysokim potencjale rozwojowym.

offer_description: New Feature Development – we turn requirements into stylish and useful new features for our web and mobile applications.
Scrum – our small cross-functional team works independently to deliver features.
Methodology – we use industry best practices to ensure we deliver code to be proud of; Code reviews, Pair Programming, TDD, BDD, and CI are all part of the toolset.
Testing – we write unit and integration tests using standard testing frameworks (JUnit, Mockito, Cucumber, and Gherkin) to keep our quality high.
Impact – each team member has a real impact on our product by collaborating with designers and product owners.
Minimal Maintenance – maintenance happens, but we spread the work throughout the year, taking about 15% of any developer’s time.
Global Scale – work with colleagues from around the world; We have teams in Canada, the USA, Poland, the Czech Republic, the Philippines, and India.
Infor is looking for

to join one of our development teams to work on Infor Workforce Management (WFM) which is a world-class web application providing comprehensive and modern solutions that strategically enhance workforce planning, execution, and analysis. Built on a proven technology platform, we continue to innovate and lead, solving tomorrow’s workforce needs for our global customer base. Originally, our backend was all Java, but today Kotlin is our first choice when writing service-oriented code. Our frontend has used all the technologies of the past decades, but today we use Angular while supporting JSP pages with JavaScript and jQuery.

requirements_description: You have a genuine interest in computers, programming and innovative technology as well as motivation to work for the world-leading technology pioneer.
A bachelor’s or master’s degree within Embedded Systems, Computer Science, Data Communications is highly qualified. However, the most important thing is your interest.
+10 years experience in C/C++
+10 years experience in embedded systems architecture and real time operating systems.
Advantages if you also have an experience in .NET.
+5 years experience in scripting languages like Python is an added advantage too.
+10 years experience in electrical hardware schematics and PCB layout.
Proficiency in use of basic electrical tools, i.e. oscilloscope, multimeter, soldering tools.
As you will be part of a global business, communication in English is required, written, and spoken alike.
Teamwork and good interpersonal skills.
offer_description: Our R&D engineers and scientists develop breakthrough technologies that change the way the world works, and industries do business. We constantly push the limits of convention, while retaining our focus on delivering quality products and solutions to our customers.

Over 60 years ago, Hitachi Energy introduced a new way of transmitting electricity across long distances with minimum losses – High Voltage Direct Current (HVDC). HVDC technology can now deliver up to 12 gigawatts of power at voltage levels of up to 1,100 kV, covering distances of more than 3,000 kilometers. HVDC enables easier integration of renewable energy sources.

You will contribute significantly to successful results in the heart of HVDC station: Modular Advanced Control for HVDC (MACH™). The MACH™ control system provides unequalled calculation capacity and enables a high degree of integration and handling for all control and protection functions. Moreover, MACH™ control provides advanced fault registration and remote-control functions. The system is designed to run 24/7 for thirty years or more, allowing the HVDC system to be controlled and protected in the most reliable way throughout its lifetime.

As a part of global R&D organization you will cooperate on daily bases with colleagues from MACH teams in Sweden and India. Development in Krakow is focused among I/O systems, DSP (digital signal processor) units, and Power Electronics control units. Working under SAFe framework you will develop further your skills and contribute into development of next generations of MACH™ system. You are going to work in the team led by Tomasz Dziubinski.
responsibilities: As an Engineer at MACH Software Development within HVDC, you will be involved in development and taking care of products assigned to team in wide range of embedded systems (ARM, DSP, SoC...), from pre-study and design to tests and integration.

You will be part of our R&D team in Hitachi Energy Technology Center. Our cross-functional SAFe/Agile teams are developing End-to-End embedded solutions including software, hardware and FPGA (Field Programmable Gate Array) in close collaboration with the global organization. Now we are looking for enthusiasts who would like to strengthen our team.

As an Engineer at MACH Software Development within HVDC, you will be involved in development and taking care of products assigned to team in wide range of embedded systems (ARM, DSP, SoC...), from pre-study and design to tests and integration.

Together with your highly competent colleagues in well-cooperating team you will further develop your skills in software development, both by taking part in, and contributing to, our notable talent pool.
We offer an exciting job in an international environment where you will get great possibilities to develop further and within Hitachi Energy.
You will work in a future-oriented industry full of interesting projects and challenges.

Wierzymy, że będąc osobą w tej roli nadal stawiasz na swój rozwój. Chcemy Ci w tym pomóc, więc oferujemy wiele możliwości doskonalenia umiejętności adekwatnych do pełnionej roli (szkolenia, warsztaty wewnętrzne i zewnętrzne), w tym:
1.  Jeśli Twoje doświadczenie będzie szło w parze z naszymi potrzebami, podczas krótkiej rozmowy telefonicznej zadamy Ci kilka pytań o Twoje doświadczenie i motywację.
2. Następnie zaprosimy Cię na rozmowę rekrutacyjną z Karoliną lub Julią z teamu rekrutacyjnego.
3. Trzeci etap to rozmowa z Head of Delivery w naszym zespole - Olą. Podczas tego spotkania będzie chciała poznać Cię lepiej oraz poruszyć jeszcze kilka technicznych zagadnień.

Pracując z nami, możesz liczyć na zaufanie do Twoich decyzji, dużą swobodę w działania w obszarze, za który odpowiadasz oraz zgrany zespół, który wymienia się wiedzą. Dbamy o partnerskie relacje, ciągłe doskonalenie i wysoką jakość tego, co dostarczamy. Jeśli to cenisz, to Brainhub będzie właściwym partnerem do współpracy.

In Bayer Crop Science IT we deliver fantastic digital experiences for our farmer customers, our supply chain partners, and our scientist who run our world class R&D pipeline of seeds, traits, crop protection products, & digital agriculture.  We would love to talk to you about what we do!

Rodzaje usług świadczonych przez platformę: przeglądanie i aktualizacja danych osobowych, dostęp do ofert umów indywidualnych i grupowych, zawarcie umowy ubezpieczenia z płatnością online, dostępu do posiadanych umów ubezpieczenia i dokumentów związanych z umową, zdalna obsługa umów, dostęp do danych szkód/świadczeń i informacji na temat statusu ich likwidacji, dostęp do ofert, weryfikacja tożsamości usługami mojeID lub aplikacją mObywatel, zakup usług medycznych i badań, podgląd dokumentacji medycznej i wyników badań.
